Text.Value: Of course he'll want you back - it's nature's will. You're meant to be together.
People are dying for the sake of your fun, kid.
So I wouldn't have to be alone anymore? He'd stay with me? Play with me?
Even when it was scary. Even when I was alone. I didn't give up.
It's done, at last. Soon the land will be unshrouded. We should return to Thaniel when we can.
Maybe that's for the best. I'm tired. Nobody real wants to play me - they only want Thaniel. They can have him.
Enough coddling. You're going back to Thaniel - now.
You're just a thieving shadow that thinks it's a child. Playtime's over - Thaniel's waiting.
I'd like that. And he would too, I think. All right, I'll do it. I want to do it.
Change is good. That's what growing up is all about. Together, you two will become more than you were before.
But you need not be alone any longer. You need not invent friends. Thaniel is back. He is waiting for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gentle, empathetic. Like talking to a young, but smart, child (it's really an ageless spirit, but presents as a child)

Text.Value: You have what you want, but not what you need: Thaniel. He's your friend, your kin - he's you.
I said gentle.

EditorData.NodeContext: Disapproving. We said something unnecessarily harsh to Oliver

Text.Value: Are you crying? You're a bit big to be crying... but I suppose that's okay.
But would he even want me back...? I've changed. A lot.
I told you already - nobody dies here. They come back, over and over, a little different every time.
Talk to him, Halsin. You know what needs to be said better than anyone.
I'm not leaving - you can't make me!

EditorData.SFXTags: [WI] Audio support as Oliver fades away
EditorData.VFXTags: [WI] VFX support as Oliver fades away

Text.Value: ...Fine. I'll do it. It might be nice to be with him again.
Of course he will. You're bound to each other - always.
Why should I go back to him? He abandoned me!
I hope you're nicer to Thaniel than you are to me.
You don't have to leave. All you have to do is lend Thaniel your strength.
Nobody's to blame here. The curse tore you two apart - now you can be reunited.
You're a bad winner, but you're still a winner. I'll go - you've taken everything that I cared about.
But I don't change, not really. So maybe I won't come back. Maybe the game will end with me.
It shall be done.
Thaniel was my friend also. I played with him, grew up while he stayed the same. He made me who I am today, and then he was ripped away from me, same as for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gentle, empathetic. Like talking to a young, but smart, child (it's really an ageless spirit, but presents as a child)

Text.Value: Oliver. Nobody is making you leave - this is your home. But it is dark, empty... lonely. I don't want you to be alone. I want you to be with Thaniel.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gentle, empathetic. Like talking to a young, but smart, child (it's really an ageless spirit, but presents as a child)

Text.Value: So I wouldn't have to make up friends to play with anymore? I'd have someone real?
It's done. More cruelly than it needed to be, but done all the same. We should return to Thaniel when we can.

EditorData.NodeContext: Satisfied - but with a tinge of criticism towards the player

Text.Value: Well done.
He's nothing to me. He left me here, all this time. I had to do everything for myself!
You were very brave and resourceful. Think of how much you'll be able to help Thaniel.
You didn't need to be so hard on him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Disapproving. We said something unnecessarily harsh to Oliver

Text.Value: Nobody dies here. They always come back to play with me, just a little different each time.
Be gentle. He's much more than a child, but he doesn't truly know that.

EditorData.NodeContext: Discreet, advisory. Doesn't want to upset Oliver any more than he already is.

Text.Value: Why couldn't you just leave me alone? Why can't I just stay here, playing? I had everything I've ever wanted, right here, and you've ruined it!
No - you were stolen from each other. Neither of you are to blame. And I know your pain. I truly do.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gentle, empathetic. Like talking to a young, but smart, child (it's really an ageless spirit, but presents as a child)

Text.Value: Bye. And thank you for playing with me.

Synopsis: Dialog with Oliver, in which the player confronts him and convinces him to rejoin Thaniel, his other half. so that the shadow curse can be lifted. Oliver will always return to Thaniel after this dialogue, but the player can be harsh or gentle in how they do so.
